name: Zero Frame
description:
Quickly and easily create zero frames or wrap layers in zero frames.


What is a Zero Frame?

A zero frame is a frame with either zero height or width. It occupies no space on the canvas but can contain and position layers within it.


Why use a Zero Frame?

Zero Frames can be used to add layers to AutoLayout with absolute positioning, i.e. they are not affected by the stacking order of other layers. It can be used in a number of ways, some of which are described in this great talk from Figma Config 2021 - Pushing Figma to its limits with Chudo, Andrei, Gleb, Vitalii, Shuaiqi


Open Source

Zero Frame is open source and contributions are welcome.
